Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In December 2023, a staff member took pictures of a youth in their
underwear with no other clothing on. The youth notified
management.
Investigation Interviews:
MDHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on January 16,
2025. MDHHS Worker reported Youth A disclosed these concerns
when she was interviewing him as a collateral contact for another
investigation. She reported Youth A stated there was no other
staff around when the incident occurred. MDHHS Worker
reported Youth A did tell someone at the facility and reported the
incident was looked into, but it is unclear what the outcome was of
the internal investigation.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the foster care
agency on January 24, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Youth A reported in December 2023, Staff 1 had
recorded a video of Youth A when Youth A was in his underwear.
When asked to explain more of what happened, Youth A reported
he was permitted by Administrator 1 to move his clothes out of the
closet in a room that was unoccupied back into his own room. He
reported he was in the process of moving his clothes to his room
when Staff 1 started his shift. Youth A reported Staff 1 works the
third shift. He reported Staff 1 told him that he could not be in the
unoccupied room. Youth A reported that when he was in the
unoccupied room, Staff 1 continued to tell him that he could not be
in this room and Youth A began to argue with him. He reported
2

Staff 1 did not like that he was not following his direction, so he
stood in the doorway of the unoccupied room looking in at Youth A
and told him he was not moving until Youth A followed redirection.
Youth A reported Staff 1 then took out his personal cell phone. At
first Youth A thought Staff 1 was going to use the Google
Translate application on his cell phone to listen to the
conversation Youth A was having on the phone with one of his
friends but then noticed Staff 1 had the camera application open
and was recording him. Youth A reported he felt uncomfortable
with Staff 1 taking a video of him because Youth A had a t-shirt
on, his boxers, and socks when the video was being recorded. He
reported Staff 1 would not leave the doorway either, so Youth A
called the police who never did anything about this situation.
Youth A reported he spoke to Administrator 1 on the phone and
then had Staff 1 switch out with another staff member due to
Youth A not feeling comfortable. He reported there were no other
staff members present when this occurred and the only youth that
was around was Youth B, but he does not know if he heard or saw
anything. Youth A reported staff are not allowed to take photos or
videos of the youth in the program with their personal cell phone
due to confidentiality.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
he had been working third shift at the facility for the past four
years. He was asked about his relationship with Youth A, and he
reported that Youth A did not like to be held accountable or told
no. Staff 1 reported Youth A would get very aggravated with staff
by yelling or sometimes physically acting out when he was
redirected. When asked if there were ever any incidents between
him and Youth A, he reported he remembered one time when he
had to redirect Youth A out of another youth’s room when he was
doing bedroom checks. He reported Youth A got very aggravated
with him over this redirection but followed the redirection. When
asked if he ever recorded a video or took photos of youth at the
facility with his cell phone he denied. Staff 1 was shown the video
of him recording Youth A and he reported he forgot about this
situation since it was over a year ago. He confirmed he was the
person recording the situation on his personal cell phone. Staff 1
reported he was trying to get the audio recording of him and Youth
A because he was speaking in Spanish. He reported he was trying
to just record the ground but did get a glimpse of Youth A. Staff 1
reported he was redirecting Youth A that he could not be in that
unoccupied room, and he became verbally argumentative about
the situation. He reported he attempted to call the on-call
supervisor, who he could not remember, but could not talk to them
3

until later. Staff 1 reported he started to record on his phone
because there are no cameras in the bedroom and was worried
Youth A may pull him into the bedroom as Youth A has a history
of being violent with staff and he wanted to ensure his safety. He
reported he did send the video to Administrator 1 as she was the
home supervisor. Staff 1 reported he was unaware of the cell
phone policy at the facility and noted that to be safe, he was trying
to record the ground and not focus on Youth A. He denied ever
taking videos or photos of youth in their underwear.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on January 27,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 1
reported she recently reviewed the incident report from December
2023 when this incident occurred. She reported Staff 1 was having
issues with Youth A not following the redirections of not being
allowed to be in a room that was not his. Administrator 1 reported
she was not the on-call supervisor that night and did not talk to
Youth A the night of the incident. She reported she does
remember providing permission to move rooms but does not recall
when she gave him permission. Administrator 1 reported Youth A
would not be allowed to move rooms at the time Staff 1 would be
coming onto shift. She reported she did receive the video in
question from Staff 1 to her agency-assigned cell phone.
Administrator 1 reported when she spoke with Staff 1 about this,
he was doing the recording because Youth A was known to make
allegations about staff and become violent and he wanted to
document what was happening. She reported the video did show
Youth A for about a second and he was fully clothed.
Administrator 1 reported that staff are not allowed to record youth
on their cell phones as this is against their cell phone policy. She
reported there was an incident report about this, and she reviewed
with all staff the cell phone policy.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at his home on January
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Translation
services were utilized for this interview. Youth B reported he
remembered a time at the facility when Youth A was in a room he
was not supposed to be in and was arguing with Staff 1 about the
situation. He reported he overheard Staff 1 and Youth A arguing in
the hallway when he was in his bedroom as he was in the room
next door. He reported he spoke to Youth A briefly in Spanish
about what was going on and Youth A told him Staff 1 was trying
to kick him out of the room. Youth B reported Youth A should have
not been in this room as this was not his room. He reported he
does not remember seeing Youth A in his underwear and does not
recall if Staff 1 had his cell phone out recording. Youth B reported
4

staff at the facility never recorded or took photos of him. He
reported Staff 1 follows the rules at the facility and youth cannot
get away with breaking the rules. Youth B reported Youth A was
the one doing the wrong thing in this situation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage captured by Staff 1 on his personal cell phone from
December 14, 2023, was reviewed. This video is less than 40
seconds and the video is mostly footage of the ground. The video
does show Youth A for a couple seconds and he is seen being
fully clothed with a long sleeve shirt, pants and socks sitting on a
bed. Within the video, Youth A is heard asking Staff 1, “Why are
you taking videos of me?” and Staff 1 responded that he is not
taking videos of him. Youth A is heard saying that he could see
Staff 1 taking a video of him and continued to ask Staff 1 why he
is taking a video of him. Staff 1 is heard asking Youth A why he
was in this room and Youth A continues to ask about why Staff 1
is taking a video of him. Youth A is heard telling Staff 1 that this is
abuse and sexual abuse to take a video of him without his
permission and Staff 1 responded, “no it is not.” The video then
cuts off.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Mobile Devise Use Policy and Agreement- This
policy stated, “Any client information including photos or
photos of documentation stored on a mobile device may be
considered part of case record is subject to HIPPA, other
confidentiality requirements, and legal discovery. Photos of
clients in ORR custody may only be captured on Bethany-
owned devices.”
- Incident Report completed by Staff 1 dated December
14, 2023- Staff 1 reported Youth A walked out of his room
and went into an unoccupied room. When Staff 1 asked
Youth A what he was doing Youth A was combative and
stated that it was none of Staff 1’s business. Youth A
reported he was given permission to be in this unoccupied
room but would not say who gave permission. Staff 1 told
Youth A that he needed to go back to his room and Staff 1
stayed in the doorway until Youth A moved. Youth A began
making phone calls to a friend and accused Staff 1 of
taking a photo of him and he was going to call police. Staff
1 reassured Youth A he was not taking a photo and that he
could call the police. Staff 1 called Administrator 1 who
directed him to switch out with another staff away from
Youth A.
5

- Agency investigation report of the incident report dated
December 15, 2023- Staff 1 called Administrator 1 when
Youth A was in another room, refusing to leave, and
became verbally escalated. Dur to the ongoing behavior
concerns Staff 1 took a short video of the situation as
additional documentation to report to Administrator 1. Youth
A reported concerns the video was sexual harassment. The
video was reviewed by Administrator 1 who reported the
video was not sexual in nature. When Administrator 1
learned the video was taken with Staff 1’s personal phone
an incident of a HIPAA violation was reported within the
agency system and the policy was reviewed with all staff
regarding use of personal technology.
- Email from MDHHS Worker dated February 4, 2025-
MDHHS Worker had reached out to the police department
to see about records from Youth A calling the police due to
these concerns. The police responded there was no reports
located for the listed individual for the specified timeframe
or any timeframe for the weeks before or after.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been employed
at the facility since January 2018. Staff 1 was provided a
written warning in May 2022 due to not completing bed
checks within the intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes.
This was found from Administrator 1 completing video
review of Staff 1’s shift. Staff 1 was provided a verbal
warning in December 2024 due to not getting his flu
vaccine timely as required by the facility. Staff 1 is up to
date on all required training including completing a
confidentially and HIPPA Training in June 2022 and annual
refresher training November 2024.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews and
documentation of the video, Staff 1 did film Youth A for less than
30 seconds on his personal cell phone which is against the
facility’s cell phone policy. It should be noted Youth A was fully
clothed within the video.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
